about.singula.paragraph2: We create stories that shape over time, building a legacy of innovation and authenticity.

catalog.description: It's not a catalog. It's an invitation. To see the city without limits. Raw lines, insistent angles. Pieces that don't ask – they exist. It's steel with soul, stroke with intention, form that speaks before function. A silence designed into structure, where even the shadow gains height. And when you look at the city more carefully, you'll see that design is the true revolution. Download it. Some carry the city on their backs, you carry it in PDF.

ral.subtitle: we recommend
ral.paragraph1: RAL colors constitute a standard color system widely used in industry, architecture, and design. Originally developed in Germany, the system assigns each color a unique numerical code, facilitating communication and exact specification of shades in projects and productions.
ral.paragraph2: This standardization ensures uniformity and consistency in color reproduction, allowing designers, manufacturers, and customers to achieve precise, high-quality results in their products and applications.
ral.paragraph3: The colors presented bla bla bla......
hpl.title: HPL COMPACT
hpl.subtitle: Phenolic
hpl.paragraph1: HPL (High Pressure Laminate) compact is a high-strength material, composed of various layers of kraft paper impregnated with thermosetting resins, pressed under high pressure and temperature. The result is a robust, durable, and extremely versatile panel, ideal for both outdoor and indoor environments.
hpl.paragraph2: Its non-porous surface makes it resistant to moisture, impacts, scratches, and UV rays, ensuring exceptional longevity with low maintenance. Additionally, it allows for a sophisticated and minimalist finish, adapting to different applications in urban furniture.
hpl.paragraph3: A functional and aesthetic choice where innovation combines with durability.

entry.text.part1: At Singula we don't just design shapes.
entry.text.part2: Whether in a bench, a planter, a divider or a decorative piece - every detail counts. Because our design lives the streets, breathes in gardens and arranges itself rigorously at home. Street, Garden or Home - the scenario changes, but the attitude remains the same.

Privacy Policy

At Singula Lda, we respect your privacy and appreciate the trust you place in us. The privacy of our clients and suppliers is fundamental to us.

It is the policy of SINGULA Lda. to respect the privacy of users regarding any information we may collect on the SINGULA website and other websites we own and operate.

The data collected on this website is processed in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) - Regulation (EU) 2016/679 - and other applicable data protection laws.

Data Collection

As a visitor, you are not required to provide any personal data to use the site. Data is collected only:

  • Directly: Name and Email via contact form.
  • Indirectly: Through Google Analytics, collecting aggregate statistical data (e.g., geographic origin, device type, browser).

Purpose

The collected data is used exclusively to process contact requests and not for any other purpose, including direct marketing.

User Rights

The data subject has the right to access, update, rectify, or delete their personal data at any time.

Storage and Sharing

Data is stored on servers located in the European Union and is not shared with third parties unless legally required.

External Links

The website may contain links to external sites for which we are not responsible in terms of privacy practices.

Contact

Guimarães, Portugal
Phone: +351 924 009 275
Email: info@singula.pt

Cookie Policy

1. What are cookies?

Cookies are small text files stored on your device when visiting a website. They help recognize your device on subsequent visits and do not collect personally identifiable information.

2. What are cookies used for?

  • Essential cookies: Ensure site security and proper functioning, including login to secure areas.
  • Analytical cookies: Monitor site performance and user behavior to improve functionality, without collecting personal data.
  • Functionality cookies: Remember user preferences and enhance features like commenting.
  • Advertising cookies: Tailor ads to user interests and limit ad frequency. Do not identify the user.
  • Third-party cookies: Measure effectiveness of external advertising or applications.

3. Types of cookies

  • Persistent cookies: Stored in the browser for future visits and used for personalized browsing.
  • Session cookies: Temporary; deleted when the user leaves the site.

4. More Information

You can disable cookies in your browser settings. For more information, visit: www.allaboutcookies.org

Terms and Conditions

At Singula Lda, we respect your privacy and appreciate the trust you place in us. The privacy of our customers and suppliers is fundamental to us.

It is the policy of SINGULA Lda. to respect users' privacy regarding any information that we may collect on the SINGULA website and other websites we own and operate.

Data collected on this website is processed in accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) - Regulation (EU) 2016/679 - and other applicable personal data protection laws, namely Law No. 58/2019 of August 8.

In accordance with Articles 13 and 14 of the GDPR, this Privacy Policy describes how we process personal data received when you browse our platform, subscribe to our newsletters, register for events (online or in person), or contact us via contact form, email, phone or mail, as well as your personal data rights and how to exercise them.

Article 4(1) of the GDPR defines personal data as “any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person.”

We only request personal information when we truly need it to provide you with a service. We do so by fair and lawful means, with your knowledge and consent. We also let you know why we’re collecting it and how it will be used. We only retain collected information for as long as necessary to provide your requested service. When we store data, we protect it using commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use or modification. We do not share any personally identifying information publicly or with third parties, except when required to by law.

Our website may contain links to external sites that are not operated by us. Please be aware that we have no control over the content and practices of these sites and cannot accept responsibility or liability for their respective privacy policies. You are free to refuse our request for your personal information, with the understanding that we may be unable to provide you with some of your desired services.

Your continued use of our website will be regarded as acceptance of our practices around privacy and personal information. If you have any questions about how we handle user data and personal information, feel free to contact us at info@singula.pt.
